final_answer.precision_note: Quoted to 3 s.f. (0.0200 mol dm-3) based on given 0.200 mol dm-3 and 25.0 cm3.

method: Use the dilution relationship c1V1 = c2V2. Here c1 = 0.200 mol dm-3 and V1 = 25.0 cm3, diluted to V2 = 250.0 cm3. Rearranging gives c2 = c1 × V1 / V2 = 0.200 × (25.0/250.0) = 0.200 × 0.100 = 0.0200 mol dm-3.
checks: Volume increases by a factor of 10, so concentration should drop by a factor of 10: 0.200 → 0.0200 mol dm-3.
